intro: Sapium microdentatum, commonly known as the narrow-toothed hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and have a distinctive fine-toothed margin. Sapium microdentatum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to thrive in moist, well-drained soils.
